Welcome to Fall 2021 EDUC 641.

This is the first course of the EDUC quantitative methods sequence. In this course, you will learn:

Types of variables (manipulation of variable types; transformations)  
Visualization of central tendency and variability  
Central limit theorem  
Inferential stats for different type of variables (t distributions, F distributions, Chi-squared distributions)  
Bayesian perspectives  
Related principles of programming  
Power analyses and effect sizes  
[Statistics they will be able to calculate: e.g., t-tests for two-group comparisons and correlations, F-tests for two-group comparisons, chi-squared contingency analyses]
